title.rendered: “Operation Success: IDF Forces Thwart Terrorism, Arrest Wanted Individuals, and Seize Weapons in Overnight Raids”

content.rendered:
IDF spokesperson:

The IDF forces, the Shin Bet, and the Border Police operated overnight in an operation in Nur al-Shams refugee camp under the command of Menashe Brigade; six armed terrorists were killed in an air strike from an aircraft.

The soldiers arrested 14 wanted individuals overnight across Judea and Samaria and seized 12 weapons in Nur al-Shams refugee camp in Menashe Brigade and in the city of Hebron in Judea Brigade.

Reservist IDF soldiers, engineering forces, Shin Bet, and Border Police operated overnight in an operation to thwart terror at the refugee camp of Nur al-Shams under the command of Menashe Brigade. During the operation, a terrorist cell was identified that threw explosives at the forces, an aircraft of the air force attacked the cell.

The forces uncovered and destroyed explosives under and alongside the roads aimed at harming our forces, arrested three wanted individuals, and seized combat gear and terror financing.

In addition, in the Deheisheh refugee camp in Etzion Brigade, the forces seized equipment at a print shop that printed incitement material for the Hamas terror organization and a drone.

The arrested wanted individuals were transferred for further investigation by the security forces.

To date, since the beginning of the war, approximately 2,550 wanted individuals have been arrested across the Judea and Samaria division and the Valley and Plains Brigade, about 1,300 of them are affiliated with the Hamas terror organization.

Attached are pictures of the seized combat equipment: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC27122023NMWEOIFNIUEF
